section.text: In this analysis, we will be examining measures 48-50 of Beethoven's Moonlight Sonata (Opus 27, Number 2, Movement 1).
Since we are starting in the middle of the piece, I will give you a hint: it is in C# minor.
The first half of measure 48 contains G#'s, B#'s, D#'s, and F#'s - a G# dominant seventh chord. Since the B# is the lowest note, the chord is in first inversion.
The second half of measure 48 contains C#'s, E's, and G#'s - a C# minor triad.
The first half of measure 49 contains D's, F#'s, and A's - a D major triad in first inversion. This is the Neapolitan sixth chord in C# minor.
The second half of measure 49 contains G#'s, B#'s, and F#'s - a G# dominant seventh chord with a missing fifth.
The first part of measure 50 contains C#'s, E's, and G#'s - another C# minor triad.
